title: Firefox crash consistently
content:
Hello,

For a few weeks now, I have a lot of crash when using firefox (I'm on windows 10). Not the whole application is crashing, just the current tab that I'm browsing. It said that a random error occured and offer me to reload the tab. It then works but crash again a few moment later (irregular). I tried to update my drivers, to uninstall and reinstall firefox (even did a full wipe of the app and its files before installing again), I tried some old firefox versions but I always have the same issue.

When I check the event viewer I have these kind of error for firefox.exe : Faulting application name: firefox.exe, version: 96.0.3.8061, time stamp: 0x61f17d54 Faulting module name: xul.dll, version: 96.0.3.8061, time stamp: 0x61f17d85 Exception code: 0xc0000005 Fault offset: 0x0000000001e75563 Faulting process id: 0x1a84 Faulting application start time: 0x01d81552ce22efba Faulting application path: C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe Faulting module path: C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\xul.dll Report Id: 6154e84a-b617-4067-a5f6-b49760fffb03 Faulting package full name: Faulting package-relative application ID:


Also : Faulting application name: firefox.exe, version: 96.0.3.8061, time stamp: 0x61f17d54 Faulting module name: unknown, version: 0.0.0.0, time stamp: 0x00000000 Exception code: 0xc0000005 Fault offset: 0x000023b9195c61f0 Faulting process id: 0x530 Faulting application start time: 0x01d815a90b9d30db Faulting application path: C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe Faulting module path: unknown Report Id: 8eb2ef4f-ee3e-4e92-b25b-37f1e1c6eec0 Faulting package full name: Faulting package-relative application ID:


Any idea on how to solve my problem please ?

Thanks in advance
creator: queroladrien

title: firefox update reminders
content: I really hope you will help me. I have tried to find a way to turn off firefox's notifications of a new update to use on my desktop, but nothing works. It's just annoying when companies take control of computer, and try to stuff something down my throat, when I've repeatedly indicated that I don't want it all. only thing worse is taking away/disabling what I DO want. So, how can I ensure that I won't see incessant pop-ups, unless & until I decide to upgrade/update? Thanks, ML

content:

title: Default homepage changes after every update
content:
I have set Firefox to update automatically when the browser is not running. Every time the Firefox browser updates, my default homepage is changed to "http://www.msn.com/?pc=ACTE". Currently, my homepage is set as "Firefox Home (Default)".

I have noticed that if the "Custom URLs..." option is selected, and a custom URL is set, but then changed to the "Firefox Home (Default)" option, the previously entered URL will revert back to "http://www.msn.com/?pc=ACTE" if the "Custom URLs..." option is selected again.

I have done multiple malware checks using Malwarebytes, but found no malware.

I have done some looking around in about:config, and found two values that weren't added by the browser. I know this because it is impossible to delete values in about:config added by the browser itself.

"browser.startup.homepage_override.buildID 20220126154723" and "browser.startup.homepage_override.mstone 96.0.3" are the two values not added by the browser. You can even see (in the attached image) that the two values can be deleted by clicking the trash can icons. However, when trying to delete them, they eventually return.

I apologize in advance if this is seen as a duplicate post, but after rigorous research, I have found no post that solves my issue.
creator: hgadm
